title: Led migration from monolith to microservices
description: 6-month project to break up our legacy monolith into microservices architecture
fullContent:
Led the migration of our core platform from a monolithic architecture to microservices over 6 months. The project involved breaking up a 500k line codebase into 12 independent services.

Two weeks before our biggest launch, at 2am, I discovered a race condition in the data sync layer that would have caused customer double-charges on every order.

I immediately pulled in Sarah from platform and Marcus from the orders team. We also brought in Dev, a contractor who knew the legacy system. Over 72 hours we traced the issue through three services.

The fix was deployed at 4:17am on day three. We ran validation for two hours before the all-clear.

The migration eventually delivered massive improvements to deployment frequency - we went from deploying every two weeks to 5-10 times per day. The runbook I wrote for handling similar issues is still used by the team today.
